examples: The business is losing money.
Money can't buy happiness.
Money means nothing to him.
A lot of people give money to good causes.
My parents give me pocket money every week.
words.defineEn: something that people use to buy and sell goods and services, can be in the form of coins or paper bills
words.defineVi: thứ mà mọi người sử dụng để mua và bán hàng hóa và dịch vụ, có thể ở dạng tiền xu hoặc hóa đơn giấy

examples: As they say, a king's chaff is worth more than other men's corn.
Unless you give me something in writing, that promise isn't worth diddly-squat.
It's not worth putting yourself in danger.
The fans had fun and got their money's worth.
The lazy employee's work was not worth a brass farthing, and he was eventually fired for his lack of effort.
words.defineEn: important or good enough to be treated or viewed in a particular way
words.defineVi: quan trọng hoặc đủ tốt để được đối xử hoặc xem theo một cách cụ thể

examples: Eve borrows money to buy expensive designer clothes - champagne taste on a beer budget!
They can borrow them for as long as they need them.
My roommate asked me if she could borrow a zucchini to make a zucchini bread.
I decided to borrow a leaf out of his book and invest some money in the stock market.
I’ve got money you can borrow if you run out.
words.defineEn: to use or take something that someone else owns, which must be given back to them later on
words.defineVi: sử dụng hoặc lấy thứ gì đó mà người khác sở hữu, sau này phải trả lại cho họ

examples: You can afford a dollar for a good cause.
He could no longer afford to run a car.
I couldn't afford to waste petrol chasing rainbows as far as Leeds and back.
They can't afford to buy school books.
We can't afford to strain at gnats and swallow camels.
words.defineEn: to be able to pay the cost of something
words.defineVi: để có thể trả chi phí của một cái gì đó

examples: To bring charges/legal action/proceedings against somebody.
First of all, they're charging an arm and a leg.
I was put in charge of the office.
The charges against the suspect will come up in court tomorrow.
Who put Tony in charge of the accounts?
words.defineEn: to ask a person to pay a certain amount of money in return for a product or service
words.defineVi: để yêu cầu một người trả một số tiền nhất định để đổi lấy một sản phẩm hoặc dịch vụ

examples: That holiday cost me a small fortune.
College tuitions cost an arm and leg nowadays.
Estimates put the war's cost at £1 million a day.
It will cost $1,500 to get the car back on the road.
The trip to the beach cost me $100, but I almost broke even after winning $90 in a contest.
words.defineEn: an amount we pay to buy, do, or make something
words.defineVi: một số tiền chúng tôi phải trả để mua, làm, hoặc thực hiện một cái gì đó

examples: He earned his money by the sweat of his brow.
He certainly earned his place in the sun.
She earns money sitting for artists.
Mary's kindness and generosity towards others has earned her love and respect from everyone she meets.
Owing to legal changes, young barristers can no longer earn easy money on undefended divorces, which are now done by solicitors.
words.defineEn: to get money for the job that we do or services that we provide
words.defineVi: để có được tiền cho công việc mà chúng tôi làm hoặc dịch vụ mà chúng tôi cung cấp

examples: She inherited her artistic talent from her mother, who is an accomplished painter.
Tom's cousin inherited a large sum of money from his parents, but he didn't have good money management skills.
He inherited his father's love of music and talent for playing the guitar - like father, like son, they share similar interests and skills.
The antique vase she inherited from her grandmother is as good as gold.
President Biden inherited a huge debt for this country.
words.defineEn: to receive money, property, etc. from someone after their demise
words.defineVi: nhận tiền, tài sản, v.v. từ ai đó sau khi họ qua đời

examples: We should probably invest in a good home security system.
He invested wisely and became incredibly rich.
He invested in Bitcoin early and made a fortune when the price skyrocketed.
They are making a fortune by investing in the stock market.
Investing in education can go a long way towards improving a nation's future.
words.defineEn: to buy houses, shares, lands, etc. with the hope of gaining a profit
words.defineVi: mua nhà, cổ phiếu, đất đai, v.v. với hy vọng kiếm được lợi nhuận

examples: Lend an ear and listen to my version.
Can you lend me your red pen to fill out this form?
She lends her pencil to a classmate who forgot to bring one.
If Laura damages the car, her dad won't lend it to her again.
You'll lend him some, since you can afford to make ducks and drakes of it.
words.defineEn: to allow someone to have or use something that you own which must be returned to you later
words.defineVi: để cho phép ai đó có hoặc sử dụng một cái gì đó mà bạn sở hữu mà phải được trả lại cho bạn sau này

examples: The fluffy pancakes owed their light texture to the addition of baking powder.
He owes money to everyone - he really has his back to the wall now.
He owes money to everyone - he really has his back to the wall now.
He still hasn't paid me the money he owes me.
However, creditors have better memory than debtors, and they will eventually come calling for what is owed to them.
words.defineEn: to have the responsibility of paying someone back a certain amount of money that was borrowed
words.defineVi: có trách nhiệm trả lại ai đó một số tiền nhất định đã vay

examples: The bank raised interest rates.
Many shops have raised their prices.
The piece raises the ghosts of a number of twentieth-century art ideas.
The book raises many important questions.
Local residents have raised concerns about late-night noise.
words.defineEn: an amount of money added to our regular payment for the job we do
words.defineVi: một số tiền được thêm vào khoản thanh toán thường xuyên của chúng tôi cho công việc chúng tôi làm

examples: The goalie saved Johnson's long-range shot.
Save data frequently.
But a truck driver saved her bacon.
Save your breath, Tom.
To save a penalty.
words.defineEn: to keep money to spend later
words.defineVi: để giữ tiền để chi tiêu sau này

examples: Recycling waste saves energy.
This guy is a waste of skin!
He wasted a golden opportunity when he missed from the penalty spot.
This is your fault, you waste of skin!
The agent counsels them obliquely against waste, repeats the letter of the law, and smiles.
words.defineEn: to use something without care or more than needed
words.defineVi: để sử dụng một cái gì đó mà không quan tâm hoặc nhiều hơn mức cần thiết
